Portfolio

My web apps were all built as explorations — of Rails, CSS animations, JavaScript, and more.

  • Grown is a Rails app for garden planning. Users can create gardens with multiple plots containing various plants, with maintenance instructions for each. Users can contribute plots to one another's gardens for a "community garden" functionality, requiring complex relationships within a Postgres database using ActiveRecord. Currently in development. View source code.
  • What's Next is the first iteration of a later group project, a platform-agnostic mobile app for reflection and self-care called Unstuck. What's Next was built in 36 hours and explores API calls and CSS animations. View source code.
  • I served as project manager on a team of four people to build Game Knight, a clone of BoardGameGeek.com. Our "quest" was to create a more user-friendly version of the site in Rails, while using an Agile workflow. View source code.
  • This Rails blog was one of my first Rails projects and explores restricting login to admins. View source code.
  • Concerts, Concerts, Concerts dives into using AJAX calls in Rails, as well as mobile-responsive design. View source code.
